sen.j: 千種は「チグサ」と4人の姓、あるいは呼び名からとられている。
sen.e: "千種"is read as Chi-gusa (the same pronunciation of "kusa" or grass in Japanese.) So the word Sanboku-Isso was coined after their name or nickname because "木 (boku)" is also read as "ki (tree)." Sanboku-Isso literally means "three trees and one grass."

Characters for Tadaki's family name were "千種" and are read as "chi-gusa" ("gusa" having the same pronunciation as "kusa" which means "grass" in Japanese). The title was coined after their names as the character "木” (boku) is also read as "ki" which means "tree," leading to "Sanboku-Isso" which literally means "three trees and one grass."
sen.cmt: I did what I could to make this easy to understand…
